text: if you're looking for a really light
elegant cookie I have a great recipe for
you it's a lacy almond orange cookie and
it's really easy and fast to grind out
half a cup of slivered almonds with
three-quarters of a teaspoon of either
anise or fennel seed in a food processor
coarsely ground
when it's ground up add it to a small
pop four tablespoons of unsalted butter
this cookie gets cooked a little bit
before it gets baked so to the stove now
what you want to do is you want to take
your butter almonds and aniseed and cook
it together with a quarter cup of sugar
3 tablespoons of honey and a half a
teaspoon of coarse salt you want to melt
everything together and then cook it for
one minute at a boil
stir it up when your mixture has boiled
for a minute turn it off and then add a
quarter cup of all-purpose flour and a
tablespoon of grated orange zest very
finely grated stir that in that's your
batter you're done it's fast easy light
and delicious all great things the
cookies need to bake on a parchment
lined baking sheet spoon one teaspoon at
a time working quickly and leave about
two inches between cookies the recipe
makes about 24 so do about 12 per sheet
make sure that you rotate these ones
during baking and dish until they're
golden brown for 6 minutes
let them cool right on the baking sheet
on the parchment paper and then use a
small spatula to run underneath them to
lift them off I don't know if you can
see the holes in there but that's why
they're called lacy cookies because they
look kind of like lace it's a light airy
cookie for the new year enjoy simply
divine and you know really one you
shouldn't feel too guilty
hi guys thanks for watching this video
be sure to click here if you want to
subscribe and click over here if you
want to continue watching more great
videos like this
